ratings.comment: I understand why there is a somewhat lower rating for Dr. B, as her harsh grading and lack of communication proved to be somewhat annoying. But she is truly not that awful, and in lab was very helpful. Moreover, since I had Dr. Jin who only used a chalkboard, the lecture she gave was almost the most I learned all semester in a lecture.

Dr. B is awful. Half of the "feedback" she gives is rude and unhelpful. She changes expectations for projects mid semester and then wonders why there's confusion. She is a harsh grader which wouldn't be a problem if she was actually helpful and had clear expectations. Class is harder than it has to be. Saving grace was Dr. Mill and her lectures.

Very tough grader with unrealistic expectations and unclear expectations for lab and group projects. Almost half of your grade in class is based off of a group project, yet she will change her mind on expectations right before the deadline. She also grades most rigorously out of anyone in the department for no reason.
Teacher claims to value respect over all else, yelling at student who call her “professor” and not “doctor”, but refuses to give students and ounce of respect.
Dominic is unnecessarily rude. Dr.B is strict
ups and downs in general a harder class sometimes values specifics more than content

Avoid if you can. She does a horrible job at explaining topics and will often sit for half of the lecture period waiting for someone to respond to her practice problems that are not helpful whatsoever. Dominic is also rude to everyone; both have a superiority complex over students. Grading is also never consistent and subjective more often than not

This class is worth 4 credits but is easily 6 credits worth of work and while not complex, takes a lot of time. Dr. B's lectures were reiterating content directly from the textbook. She is also very inflexible with students. I expected analytical chemistry to be difficult, but this was too much for only 4 credits.

Take 327 if you can. This class is not worth it. TAs don't do anything, as they don't know the content which is extremely frustrating. You're pretty much on your own, the course staff doesn't give any help at all. Dominic (stockroom guy) will stress you out and yell. Dr. B is VERY strict. Group project was so much work and theyre picky graders

They keep deleting all of our ratings?? She was at a 1.36. Dr. B is not a good lecturer. the only helpful practice problems are never gone over as "25% of the class needs to email her their attempt" before she goes over it. That never happens. So many trick questions on the test too. Super strict and Dominic is very rude to students for no reason.

My experience with Chem 329 was different than most in recent years, given that I had it fully in-person. Dr. B. co-taught this class, but when she lectured, I honestly enjoyed it. Dr. B. tries hard to make the content clear and gives out homework and practices problems. However, her exams were extremely difficult. Altogether, she's a decent prof.

She is nice and open to meetings, but does not teach very much in class. The information is not high level and is closer to HS level chemistry. The project labs were hard to understand with the way they were written and it made it way more difficult. The assignments were difficult, as expected, but the grading was super strict and rubric's vague.
Definitely the best professor in Madison!
She is knowledgeable, but is extremely strict when it comes to grading. She can be very understanding if you explain, but she can get annoyed if you challenge anything she says.
I don't know why she is even qualified to teach.

She is terrible at explaining things. She will begin to solve a complex problem and then stops. She then says to do this problem outside of class but doesn't give the answer to the problem or anything to base the problem on. She also does not give any sort of review for midterms which makes it increasingly hard to understand material.

She does not do a very good job of explaining the most important and most difficult topics of the class. Whenever she asks the class a question, she will not move on until people respond even if the answer relates to something not taught yet. When giving examples, she will often not give the answers and expect that students will figure it out alone
i luv her teaching. A little vague on her explanations tho

I simply can't get past the point that she talks to her class as though it's a lecture pit full of 8 year old's. She goes through each lecture slide at such an extremely slow speed that it's impossible to keep attention. She has a very frustrating habit of answering every question with another question. Her and Dominic are a formidable duo.

Easily one of the worst professors I've ever had. I have no idea what she is ever teaching in class and then she expects us to understand how to solve a problem in which she taught little about. She also treats the class as if they are middle schoolers which is so annoying. She simply does not know how to teach a class whatsoever.

Labs are a huge time commitment to the course, but reading the textbook/practice problems is more important for the grade. Not necessarily difficult because of her teaching, but this class is demanding, and tests had low averages.

Not a good experience. Expect to put in a lot of work outside of class if you want a good grade. Each week she asked for feedback and rarely were any changes implemented despite our constant complaints. Answer keys were not posted for exams or practice problems. Labs were often confusing and homework and exams were filled with mistakes and typos.

This class is a disaster. There is 0 help from TAs nor the professors, and the lab directors are a joke too. Anytime you ask for help they tell you to read the textbook. We had the final today and 30-40% of the exam was stuff we had a singular lecture on. I know all chem and chemE majors have to take this class but prepare yourself for pain.

It feels like that she treats us like children. She isn't delivering the lectures (FA21), but she formats the slides and lab videos, which are not helpful in terms of understanding the material. The only thing saving me is the fact that the TA's are good and they are really willing to help.

Nice person, but awful class. Seemed like she tried to shove a 16 week course into an 8 week summer class. Participation was graded, and lectures only covered the basic topic while exams expected you to have the deeper knowledge. Lab topics were often taught AFTER the lab. 16 hours of work outside of class per week was more like per 2-3 days.

I took the class jointly taught by 'Dr. B' and Dr. Choi. The class wasn't hard, but there was a ton of busy work worth 5 points each. She consistently posted the lab manual to canvas late and gave vague rubrics that included 50% of the material she actually desired to be on the projects, making the project lab annoying. Group project was annoying.

She clearly doesn't put effort into teaching. The homework is consistently confusing and full of typos. Her lectures focus a ton of time on the simple common knowledge material and then she assigns readings and just assumes we understand the more complicated stuff. It seems like she is unsteady with the material herself or just an awful lecturer.

Dr B is the my least favorite teacher in college. While other professor encourage you to ask question, Dr B refuses to answer them. The lab is hard and time-consuming, while this is natural of Achem and shall not blame teacher, but Dr B treat student like kids and giving no useful teaching in class. You could just read the powerpoint.

Treats her students like children. Today she said that she doesn't remember anything about kinetics and to refer to our books if we had questions. Let me repeat that- SHE DOESN'T REMEMBER KINETICS. I've checked multiple times to make sure I'm not accidentally taking an intro chemistry course. The class is an absolute joke so far. Where's the rigor?

Dr. Buchberger is the WORST professor I have ever had at UW. She thinks she cares about her students, but in reality, she is just lazy with grading and lecturing. Overall, the class content was interesting but presented in a confusing way. Get ready for this class to take over your semester due to all the work.

High grade cutoffs for a 300 level class. Class structure is not good. Workload is a lot, especially online. Had to put in double the recommended time for this class. 4 credits is a scam, w/ 2 4 hour labs a week. Discussion doesn't review content, it's just more work. Exams were tough. Recommend waiting for in person class to come back if possible.

"Dr. B" and her staff attempted to be our the cool professor while simultaneously treating us like children. Lab sessions were the worst and largely based on fear and threats instead of learning. The content wasn't particularly difficult but there was TONS of work and lab reports were due at midnight the day you had the lab which sucked.

Prepare to experience 30+ hours a week of AChem along with projects that are due the morning after midterms that take 12+ hours. Also, expect no extensions or mercy from the professor. Gl. This class and the way it's taught would be far more manageable in-person but it's insanely difficult online.

Acts like a person who understands what the students are going through. However, she also has one of the worst and unforgiving class schedules online for no reason other than to make it hard. We already have no lab partners and more to hoops to jump through in lab but we're expected to finish in 4 hours. I spend 30ish hours a week on this class.

Overall, shes a good person but the class structure and content made it difficult for people to succeed. Its mostly graded on the group project lab and tests. Her lectures did not always relate to the hw but she expects answers like the homework and slides, so make sure to study both. Also, her cutoff for an A is higher than other teachers.
